@rmountaineer Thanks! One line in the T&C says “Each participant waives all moral rights in an to the photo submissions.”
@rmountaineer Sounds like a fun contest to enter, except that it also sounds like I’d be giving up all rights to my photo. Is that right?
Also ocean shores, rivers, and snow-capped peaks pretty much everywhere I looked. Not a bad commute.
This morning on my drive to work I saw snow geese flying in formation right over me, a blue heron, and bald eagles.
@caseyliss As a Canadian, I look on all of this with amazement. Our system isn’t perfect, but we’ve received excellent, timely care.

Party lines. https://t.co/ls8yvBiPPn
As John Donne put it, “Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in mankind.”
But they all meant something to someone, & we are diminished by their loss, whether they be a celebrity or the person who delivers the mail.
The names of the dead in Aleppo are not known to (most) of us. Neither are the names of the thousands who’ve passed away in our own lands.
But every year people die, and in that, this year is probably like so many others that have come before. Most of them are fairy anonymous.
So many are saying 2016 was a bad year because of the loss of so many people we’ve come to “know” through media, movies, and music…
I’m sad to hear of the death of Carrie Fisher. And Alan Rickman, Prince, Leonard Cohen, David Bowie, Gene Hackman, and so many others…

I don’t think Joe has any idea what kind of fire he’s playing with here. https://t.co/lerspApHba
@TwiggJohn Personally, I would have a hard time turning the other cheek. But I think that is a flaw, and not in line with the Kingdom of God
@TwiggJohn It’s interesting that the believers in the early church—who regularly faced real danger—are never called to take up arms.
@TwiggJohn …but he never commands his followers to do the same. In fact, quite the opposite. Neither do any of the other NT writers.
@TwiggJohn Jesus is in the position of being the righteous judge, and therefore had the right to clear his “father’s house”…
@TwiggJohn Plus you also have to consider all the other passages that point to non-resistance, both from Jesus and the apostles.
@TwiggJohn Lots of debate about the meaning of that verse. Two swords would have been almost no use against what they were facing.
@TwiggJohn But then Jesus rebukes them for using a sword to attack the high priest’s servant when he’s arrested a short time later.
Joe Walsh seems pretty disconnected from anything resembling the Jesus of the Bible. More like Weird Al’s Ghandi 2. https://t.co/fBOqOPHYMa
